text: went to the 23rd bottle store this weekend, and me and a friend filled a empty wine bottle box with 12 beers for our advent then swapped boxes. 12 days till christmas starts today.
<@U0EL0GLEL> I LOVE THAT

And the 23rd store is cool, but johns carries way more and a lot more lower priced bottles. 23rd felt like everything was 3-15 a bottle, johns has lots of quality $1-5 bottles and more foreign selection. but for a shop that is closer the 23rd store was pretty nice.
rad, thx for review!!
day 12 on our advent (lastnight) was this: <https://www.beeradvocate.com/beer/profile/16846/63672/>, :ok_hand:

attachments.title: Figgy Pudding | Block 15 Brewery & Restaurant
attachments.text: Figgy Pudding is a English Strong Ale style beer brewed by Block 15 Brewery & Restaurant in Corvallis, OR. 89 out of 100 with 47 reviews, ratings and opinions.
attachments.fallback: BeerAdvocate: Figgy Pudding | Block 15 Brewery & Restaurant

text: so awesome, dont think ive seen that one yet. but ive had one from a different brewer with that name and concept. great stuff
so far out shopping for advent beers has been at: hollywood liquor (surprisingly amazing selection), sarveza + belmont station.
need to hit up john's market to round out the last few beers.
or maybe even 23rd!!! bc we're getting to the point where nothing is 'new'...so might need to bolster w imports
havnt been to hollywood liquor or sarveza. but been in belmont many times. great place but their prices are typically higher than johns
esspecially their keg prices they are notoriously higher

but they are also nicer people to deal with. we used to frequently get kegs for my last job we used johns a lot and they were rude about picking one up frequently. and i had the same experience when i would go for my own. sometimes its fine sometimes it was like are you serious you want to spend $$ here?! so odd, but it was only when dealing with kegs.
oh i love the imports, johns has them all laid out by country
so much amazing stuff
johns system is super slick.
tho i haven't had keg experience

its fine usually, they have a list you pick what you want and go to the back and someone gives it to you, sometimes the guy there was just seriously rude. then the next guy loaded it into my car for me

honestly i was kinda disappointed when we just went to belmont.. hadn't been there in a while, seems like they remodeled. they always have 'a lot' of items, but the way they stock seems to be multiple per brewery vs that one magic gem from every brewery. you gotta hunt for the new and fun/good.
but for the $ bridgeport has the best deal on a keg of their beer. 1/4 for $70 its the cheapest craft beer in town
!! and good to know abt bridgeport.
yep thats why i stopped going to belmont for the most part
brilliant.
saraveza is super tiny! but great for that part of town (north)
cool will need to check it out
i get that bottle shops need to stock an array of things (local) but sometimes i'm so over the fact that half a shop is what i could get at fred meyer.
yep, and fred meyer does a pretty good job on their selection anways
just found Imperials events list in my inbox. <https://mystore.ncrsilver.com/app/Email/View?m=Q7AUKGCKbE6-_ScbyMUIuQ&e=Imv01GhiVki5aCyR_9-wqA&c=A89544597F66454192A97C984ECE399D>
